results.title: Potatoes
results.creator_credit: Robert Lang, Roman Bittman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This documentary deals with the gradual shift from the family farm, to corporation-run farms, with all the ensuring problems and personal hardship. It is an incisive evaluation of what is happening in North America particularly St Johns Valley of New Brunswick and in world wide agriculture today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lang, Roman Bittman and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Poltergeist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tobe Hooper, Frank Marshall, Steven Spielberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The secure existence of an quintessentially middle-class nuclear family living in suburban California is shattered by supernatural forces in this updated haunted-house narrative produced by Spielberg in the same year he produced and directed “E.T.”. The youngest daughter, ten year old Carol Anne, is inextricably drawn to strange phenomenon that communicate via the family television and which eventually pull her through the screen into the spirit world. Though the film was directed by Tobe Hooper, it is widely considered to carry Spielburg’s trademark style in its setting, its childlike sense of wonder and horror, and its extensive use of scary special effects. Cast: Jobeth Williams, Craig T. Nelson, Beatrice Straight, Dominique Dunn, Oliver Robins, Heather O’Rourke. Written by Steven Spielberg, Michael Grais and Mark Victor. Music by Jerry Goldsmith.

results.title: Gold in the hills: a case study in market segmentation
results.creator_credit: Hal Trussell, Carol Dunn, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Marketing / Coast Community College District”.
The Irvine Co. is one of the largest property developers in the United States. The success of their planned communities has depended on a careful study of the needs of different segments of the housing market and building to meet those needs. The program explores the history of the company and how it has adapted to changing economic situations in order to design communities which encourage people to live there all their lives, even though their needs change as they age.

results.title: Prophecy: a case study in marketing research
results.creator_credit: Linda Jassim, Carol Dunn, Coast Community College and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Marketing / Coast Community College District”.
The Disney Channel is shown consulting the marketing research company ASI to find out how best to place Disney in the cable TV market. Executives from the companies explain the four P’s of marketing - product, price, place, promotion - to be considered when planning a market strategy. Examples of different types of surveys and testing are shown, including phone surveys, focus groups and previews. There is a short explanation of how the data is tabulated, indexed, collated and evaluated, but it is stressed that, however valuable the research is, intuition and experience also play a major part.

results.title: Drugs and side effects
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to provide the intellectual disability care worker with an overview of drugs and society, the role of the careworker, the forms and administration of drugs, the most commonly prescribed drugs, non-prescription or over-the-counter drugs, and suggestions for teaching self administration. Accompanied by a 42p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Pot purri
results.creator_credit: Cameron Guers, Derek Lamb, Grant Munro, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Rhoda Leyer, Colin Low, Vic Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A selection of publicity clips mounted together in one film to show techniques of NFB animators. As in ‘Hors d’oeuvre’, these films were produced originally for Government Agencies, to carry a message to the public about fire, water, traffic safety and mailing early for Christmas. Punctuated with adroit sound effects, each clip drives home its message humorously and succinctly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cameron Guers, Derek Lamb, Grant Munro, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Rhoda Leyer, Colin Low, Vic Jobin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Postman Pat and his black and white cat
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “Postman Pat” Greendale’s favourite postman who loves to deliver the mail with Jess his black and white cat. The first adventure sees Pat, haven broken his own glasses, borrow an old pair of Mrs Goggins. The glasses not being suited to Postman Pat are the cause of a slight muddle as the letters are being delivered to the wrong addresses because Pat can’t read them properly. Pat makes a clay model of his cat Jess, in the second story. He enters it into the Greendale art show where the statue wins a special prize.

results.title: Postman Pat's ABC
results.brief_description: Learn the ABC with Postman Pat. This story takes place in the little village of Greendale. Pat and his trusty companion Jess, the black and white cat, help young Tom Pottage to remember his alphabet. This delightful animation by Ivor Wood is an excellent aid for young children learning the alphabet.
